revised_title: Description and Analysis of a New Amphibious Bipes
tldr: This article describes a new species of amphibious animal, found in swampy areas, with a unique appearance and characteristics. It has a head similar to an eel, small eyes, and a mouth with sharp teeth for biting and grinding food. It has two feet with four fingers each, ending in claws. The skin is black and covered in small scales, and it has a tail fin. The author discusses its possible relation to lizards and requests further research on its classification.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Zoology > Herpetology
